{include "affiliate_loader"} On Monday, the Missouri State Legislature may pass a bill designed to intimidate protesters. We need action from you! {include "pre-header-spacing"}{beacon}

{include "default_salutation"} –

Without intervention, the Missouri General Assembly will limit the right to protest on Monday. We need your action now. Call your representative immediately and ask them to block SB 26: 573-269-3772.

After the police murder of George Floyd in summer 2020, the entire nation saw the power of protest to confront white supremacy in our culture and in our government.

Now, the Missouri General Assembly is clapping back in the cruelest way. SB 26 seeks to intimidate protesters, chill free speech, empower law enforcement to punish protesters more harshly, and more.

Okay, let's break down the specifics:

  • Under SB 26, the crime of obstructing the highway would become a felony with stiffer financial penalties and increased possibility for a lengthy prison sentence, up to seven years. There is no evidence that those penalties will stop highway obstruction. There is plentiful evidence that it will lead to the targeting of protestors and growth in the number of people Missouri imprisons.
  • This bill also makes it more difficult to challenge bad policing. When filing a complaint against law enforcement, victims would be required to sign a highly intimidating written statement. Accused officers would know the investigators on their investigation, allowing more intimidation to occur. Additionally, this legislation would shield law enforcement officers "against civil claims made against them in their official and individual capacities if the alleged conduct arose in the court and scope of their obligations and duties as law enforcement officers." This is the opposite of accountability.
  • Finally, the bill adds a provision around police department funding. It would allow any taxpayer to sue if a given police department's budget is cut by more than 12 percent. Decisions about local budgets are just that, local. They should be set by community values and input.

Democracy takes hard work by all of us. Please call your representative now at 573-269-3772 and tell them to block SB 26.

Thanks for sticking with us,
